bibl.title: Albert Friedrich v. State of Washington. Affidavit and Order
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: United States Circuit Court, District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON.
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF ALBERT FREDERICH FOR A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS.
STATE OF WASHINGTON, COUNTY OF KING.

W. B. TYLER BEING DULY SWORN DEPOSES AND SAYS: THAT HE IS ONE OF THE ATTORNEYS FOR THE PETITIONER IN THE MATTER ABOVE ENTI- TLED. THAT THE FIRM OF TYLER & TYLER WERE APPOINTED BY THE JUDGE OF THE SUPERIOR COURT OF KING COUNTY STATE OF WASHINGTON TO DEFEND THE SAID FREDERICH FOR THE REASON THAT SAID FREDERICH HAD NO MONEY OR PROPERTY OF ANY KIND AND WAS NOT ABLE TO EMPLOY COUNSEL. AFFIANT AVERS THAT THE SAID FREDERICH IS NOW CONFINED IN THE PEN- ITENTIARY AT WALLA WALLA AND THAT HE HAS NO MONEY OR PROPERTY OF ANY KIND WHATSOEVER,NOR HAS HE ANY MEANS OR METHOD OF OBTAINING THE SAME.
SUBSCRIBED AND SWORN TO BEFORE ME THIS 9 DAY OF September 1892
NOTARY PUBLIC IN AND FOR THE STATE OF WASHINGTON, RESIDING AT SEATTLE. Port
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF ALBERT FREDERICH FOR A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS.

UPON READING AND CONSIDERING THE AFFIDAVIT OF W.B. TYLER AND IT APPEARING THAT THE PETITIONER ALBERT FREDERICH HAS NO MONEY OR PROPERTY WHATSOEVER AND NO MEANS OF OBTAINING THE SAME, IT IS ORDER- ED THAT THE USUAL COSTS AND FEES FOR THE APPEAL HEREIN FROM THE ORDER AND DECREE OF THIS COURT REFUSING TO ISSUE A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS HEREIN, BE REMITTED AND THAT THE CLERK OF THIS COURT BE ORDERED AND THAT HE IS HEREBY ORDERED TO TRANSMIT THE RECORD IN THIS CASE AS SET FORTH IN THE NOTICE OF APPEAL HEREIN TO THE SUPREME COURT OF THE UNITED STATES.
IN THE SUPERIOR Circuit COURT OF THE STATE United States District OF WASHINGTON IN AND FOR THE COUNTY OF
In the Matter of the Application of Plaintiff Alfred Fredrich for a Writ of Habeas Corpus Defendant
Received copy of the within this day of 189
FILED Sept 10 1892 IN THE U. S. CIRCUIT COURT.
